info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 12 at 2:32PM CDT until June 17 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Norman OK
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma...
Clear Boggy Creek near Caney affecting Atoka County.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Clear Boggy Creek near Caney.
* WHEN...From this afternoon to early Tuesday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, The creek reaches bankfull levels in western Atoka County and the northeastern edge of Bryan County. High stages on small feeder streams could further result in greater-than-bankfull overflows to mainstem bottomlands. Croplands... pastures... and some secondary rural roads along and near Clear Boggy Creek are affected.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 18.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 26.0 feet. - Forecast...The Clear Boggy Creek is expected to rise to a crest of 25.8 feet early Sunday morning. - Action stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY TUESDAY AFTERNOON
